title: Apple COO Jeff Williams set to retire later this year
description: Macworld Apple has announced a coming transition to its senior leadership team. Chief Operating Officer Jeff Williams will retire late this year. His duties as COO will transition later this month to Sabih Khan, who is currently senior vice president of Operations. Khan has been with Apple since 1995, joining the company three years before Williams. When Jony Ive left Apple in 2019, the design team transitioned to report directly to Williams. It will continue to do so—as will the Apple Watch and Health teams he oversees—until he retires later this year. After that, the design team will report directly to CEO Tim Cook. In the announcement, Cook said of Williams: Jeff and I have worked alongside each other for as long as I can remember, and Apple wouldn’t be what it is without him. He’s helped to create one of the most respected global supply chains in the world; launched Apple Watch and overseen its development; architected Apple’s health strategy; and led our world class team of designers with great wisdom, heart, and dedication. I am and will always be beyond grateful for his numerous contributions to Apple over the years and his loyal friendship. Jeff’s true legacy can be seen in the amazing team he’s created and, while he’ll be greatly missed, he leaves the work of the future in incredible hands. Tim Cook As for his retirement, Williams said he intends to “spend more time with friends and family, including five grandchildren and counting.”
byline: Author: Jason Cross, Senior Editor, Macworld
excerpt: Williams' role will be filled by the current senior VP of Operations, Sabih Khan.
text: Image: Apple Apple has announced a coming transition to its senior leadership team. Chief Operating Officer Jeff Williams will retire late this year. His duties as COO will transition later this month to Sabih Khan, who is currently senior vice president of Operations. Khan has been with Apple since 1995, joining the company three years before Williams. When Jony Ive left Apple in 2019, the design team transitioned to report directly to Williams. It will continue to do so—as will the Apple Watch and Health teams he oversees—until he retires later this year. After that, the design team will report directly to CEO Tim Cook. In the announcement, Cook said of Williams: Jeff and I have worked alongside each other for as long as I can remember, and Apple wouldn’t be what it is without him. He’s helped to create one of the most respected global supply chains in the world; launched Apple Watch and overseen its development; architected Apple’s health strategy; and led our world class team of designers with great wisdom, heart, and dedication. I am and will always be beyond grateful for his numerous contributions to Apple over the years and his loyal friendship. Jeff’s true legacy can be seen in the amazing team he’s created and, while he’ll be greatly missed, he leaves the work of the future in incredible hands. Tim Cook As for his retirement, Williams said he intends to “spend more time with friends and family, including five grandchildren and counting.” Jason has written about technology for more than 25 years - first in the gaming press, then focusing on enthusiast PCs and general technology. He enjoys learning how complicated technology works and explaining it in a way anyone can understand.
html:
Image: Apple

Apple has announced a coming transition to its senior leadership team. Chief Operating Officer Jeff Williams will retire late this year.

His duties as COO will transition later this month to Sabih Khan, who is currently senior vice president of Operations. Khan has been with Apple since 1995, joining the company three years before Williams.

When Jony Ive left Apple in 2019, the design team transitioned to report directly to Williams. It will continue to do so—as will the Apple Watch and Health teams he oversees—until he retires later this year. After that, the design team will report directly to CEO Tim Cook.

In the announcement, Cook said of Williams:

Jeff and I have worked alongside each other for as long as I can remember, and Apple wouldn’t be what it is without him. He’s helped to create one of the most respected global supply chains in the world; launched Apple Watch and overseen its development; architected Apple’s health strategy; and led our world class team of designers with great wisdom, heart, and dedication. I am and will always be beyond grateful for his numerous contributions to Apple over the years and his loyal friendship. Jeff’s true legacy can be seen in the amazing team he’s created and, while he’ll be greatly missed, he leaves the work of the future in incredible hands.

Tim Cook

As for his retirement, Williams said he intends to “spend more time with friends and family, including five grandchildren and counting.”

Jason has written about technology for more than 25 years - first in the gaming press, then focusing on enthusiast PCs and general technology. He enjoys learning how complicated technology works and explaining it in a way anyone can understand.
